oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Edith Scott Coll Memory Book_025 p. 11a
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photographs and captions from Miss Edith Scott's Memory Book, started July 1957. Her ancestors included the Scott, Deaderick, Crozier, Ramsey, Anderson and Alexander families. Francis Alexander Ramsey Scott (1827-1909) married Margaretta Frances Deaderick (1833-1909) in 1857. They were the parents of eleven children, including daughter Miss Edith Scott (1878-1971). Caption information appears below in the Full Text field.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Photographs; Scrapbooks; Families; History; Wallpapers;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8808. Please refer to Image Number if available and provide a brief description of the photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Now this is the same scene we had over the mantel. I shall ever be grateful that Mrs. Ogle had these pictures taken when she and Dr. Ogle were living at Cedar Grove. She said she wished the pictures could have been colored but in that case, they could not have been copied, and I would not have these lovely copies, which she most graciously had made for me. When the Baptist Church bought Cedar Grove from Dr. and Mrs. Ogle, they seemed to appreciate the beauty and historical value of the paper, but they sold it to Mrs. Thomas Berry, who had it steamed off the walls, and then gave it to the University. I wish I had known when she had it taken off for I would have liked to have bought this picnic scene, as there were two of them. I would have covered it with glass and framed it, and wouldn't it have been a sweet picture!
